pl.tomek_krzyszko.bluemanager

Class BlueManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • pl.tomek_krzyszko.bluemanager.BlueManager

  • public class BlueManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Main manager class used to control scanning and managing scan results.

        public void initilize(android.content.Context context,
                      @Nullable
                      BlueConfig blueConfig)
        Parameters:
        context - Context used to initialize app context in library
        blueConfig - BlueConfig used to change default BlueManager configuration. If null, default config will be used.

      • startBlueScanner

        public void startBlueScanner(BlueScannerServiceConnection blueScannerServiceConnection)
                      throws BlueManagerExceptions
        Starts BlueScanner service. If the service is started already, it does nothing.
        Throws:
        BlueManagerExceptions

      • stopBlueScanner

        public void stopBlueScanner()
        Stops BlueScanner service.

      • checkLocationIsOn

        public boolean checkLocationIsOn(android.content.Context context)
        Check if location service is enabled. If not method will start proper intent.
        Parameters:
        context - Context used to manage system services.
        Returns:
        whether or not you have location service on.

      • checkBluetooth

        public boolean checkBluetooth(android.content.Context context)
        Check if bluetooth is enabled. If not method will start proper intent.
        Parameters:
        context - Context used to manage system services.
        Returns:
        whether or not you have bluetooth enabled.

      • isBluetoothLowEnergyEnabled

        public boolean isBluetoothLowEnergyEnabled()
        Check if bluetooth low energy is enabled.
        Returns:
        whether or not you have bluetooth low energy enabled on the device.

      • pairDevice

        public void pairDevice(android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice device)
        Method used to force device pairing process.
        Parameters:
        device - BluetoothDevice which you want to pair your phone.

      • startScanning

        public void startScanning(boolean lowEnergy)
        Start bluetooth scanning process with default parameters. Remember to stop scanning when it will be not needed.

      • startScanning

        public void startScanning(java.lang.String address,
                          android.bluetooth.le.ScanSettings scanSettings,
                          java.util.List<android.bluetooth.le.ScanFilter> scanFilters,
                          boolean lowEnergy)
        Start bluetooth scanning process.
        Parameters:
        address - String in format XX:XX:XX:XX:XX:XX If address is not null, scanning process will be working until given device will be found.
        scanSettings - settings with scanning type
        scanFilters - for scanner which set conditions for scanning
        lowEnergy - whether or not you will be using bluetooth low energy scanner

      • startScanning

        public void startScanning(java.lang.String address,
                          java.util.UUID[] uuids,
                          boolean lowEnergy)
        Start bluetooth scanning process.
        Parameters:
        address - String in format XX:XX:XX:XX:XX:XX If address is not null, scanning process will be working until given device will be found.
        uuids - array for scanner. Scan method will return only this BlueDevices which will have service UUID from that array
        lowEnergy - whether or not you will be using bluetooth low energy scanner

      • startScanning

        public void startScanning(long time,
                          android.bluetooth.le.ScanSettings scanSettings,
                          java.util.List<android.bluetooth.le.ScanFilter> scanFilters,
                          boolean lowEnergy)
        Start bluetooth scanning process for specific amount of time
        Parameters:
        time - in milliseconds
        scanSettings - settings with scanning type
        scanFilters - for scanner which set conditions for scanning
        lowEnergy - whether or not you will be using bluetooth low energy scanner

      • startScanning

        public void startScanning(long time,
                          java.util.UUID[] uuids,
                          boolean lowEnergy)
        Start bluetooth scanning process for specific amount of time
        Parameters:
        time - in milliseconds
        uuids - array for scanner. Scan method will return only this BlueDevices which will have service UUID from that array
        lowEnergy - whether or not you will be using bluetooth low energy scanner

      • stopScanning

        public void stopScanning(boolean lowEnergy)
        Stop bluetooth scanning process.

      • forceCheckNearbyBlueDevices

        public void forceCheckNearbyBlueDevices()
        Used to force remove all BlueDevices in BlueScanner.discoveredDevices that have not been detected fore some time and are considered lost. Information about lost devices is passed to BlueScanner.blueDeviceScanListeners.

      • connectDevice

        public boolean connectDevice(BlueDevice blueDevice,
                             BlueDeviceConnectionListener blueDeviceConnectionListener)
        Connects to the given discovered device. There is a limit for simultaneously connected Bluetooth devices which seems to vary on different devices. It was 4 in the beginning, in 2013 it was increased to 7. https://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=68538
        Parameters:
        blueDevice - BlueDevice to connect to
        blueDeviceConnectionListener - BlueDeviceConnectionListener that receives various callbacks
        Returns:
        true if connection was initiated successfully, false if discovered device does not exist or is already connected

      • disconnectFromDevice

        public boolean disconnectFromDevice(BlueDevice blueDevice)
        Disconnects from given discovered device.
        Parameters:
        blueDevice - BlueDevice to disconnect from. If null it disconnects all active BlueDevice connections.
        Returns:
        true if disconnected successfully, false if discovered device does not exist or was not connected

      • performActionOnDevice

        public boolean performActionOnDevice(BlueDevice blueDevice,
                                     BlueAction blueAction,
                                     BlueDeviceActionListener blueDeviceActionListener)
        Class responsible for performing BlueAction on given BlueDevice
        Parameters:
        blueDevice - on which action will be performed
        blueAction - represents BlueAction which will be performed
        blueDeviceActionListener - represents BlueDeviceActionListener class which will be returning callbacks
        Returns:
        true if method successfully starts proper bluetooth process, false if device or action are wrong

      • addBlueDeviceScanListener

        public void addBlueDeviceScanListener(BlueDeviceScanListener blueDeviceScanListener)
        Adds BlueDeviceScanListener to the scanner.
        Parameters:
        blueDeviceScanListener - listener to add
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when provided listener is null

      • removeBlueDeviceScanListener

        public boolean removeBlueDeviceScanListener(BlueDeviceScanListener blueDeviceScanListener)
        Removes BlueDeviceScanListener from the scanner.
        Parameters:
        blueDeviceScanListener - listener to remove. If null it removes all BlueDeviceScanListeners registered in the scanner.
        Returns:
        true if object was removed from the scanner, false if the listener was not registered in the scanner

      • getDiscoveredDevices

        public java.util.List<BlueDevice> getDiscoveredDevices(java.lang.String address)
        Parameters:
        address - hardware address of the device. If null it returns all nearby devices.
        Returns:
        List containing all BlueDevices currently considered to be nearby Android device. - it is present in BlueScanner.discoveredDevices collection. Return empty list if the devices are not considered to be discovered.

      • refreshDeviceCache

        public void refreshDeviceCache(BlueDevice blueDevice)
        Method helps clearing device cache memory. http://stackoverflow.com/questions/22596951/how-to-programmatically-force-bluetooth-low-energy-service-discovery-on-android

      • getPairedDeivces

        public java.util.Set<android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice> getPairedDeivces()
        Return paired BluetoothDevice set.

      • setDeviceDiscoverable

        public void setDeviceDiscoverable(int seconds)
        Make local device discoverable to other devices for given time
        Parameters:
        seconds -
